basics.name: André Paradis
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: André Paradis is based in Quebec City, Canada, and has earned a bachelor degree in electrical and computer engineering from Université de Sherbrooke in 1996.  M. Paradis started his career at CAE Electronics (www.cae.ca) working on CAE's next generation real-time image generator used in commercial and military full flight simulators.  The work involved the development and testing of 3D rendering algorithms in C++ on unix platforms (SGI Irix, Sun Solaris and linux). In 1999, M. Paradis begun to work primarily in Java on web applications architecture and development at several companies: Telus, Seaquest TI, and Documex.  The work included the development a search engine used for Telus clients web sites, a web content management system based on XML, a railway inspection solution for Documex, and a distributed object middleware and API used to integrate many piece of marine equipments (codar, transponder, intelligent buoy, and others) with a client API available in C#, Java and C++. M. Paradis has performed consulting engagements for Trafic3w in the architecture and development of line of business web applications for clients like Desjardins General Insurances and the provincial government. Since late 2015, M. Paradis is leading a team of software engineers at Olympus, delivering a cloud based solution to build/support and collect data from scientific instruments

work.summary: Sotware engineering lead for the cloud software development team
highlights: Architecture and implementation of REST based APIs used by websites and IoT devices and mobile apps
Implementation of the frontend tech stack (angularjs, webpack, kendo ui)
Architecture and implementation of a web application handling device manufacturing workflows
Architecture and implementation of a new customer website for device fleet managment, device data managment and other advanced features
All solutions architected around Microsoft Azure PAAS: Service Bus, App Service, API Manager, DocumentDB, SQL Server, Azure AD and AD B2C

work.summary: Trafic3w is a web development agency providing turn key solutions and consulting services in the area of web application development and digital marketing
highlights: Architected and implemented Desjardins General Insurances web single sign-on solution based on SAML and WS-Federation
Worked on online services software integration between StateFarm Canada and Desjardins (front-end, backend)
Performed the migration of Desjardins Insurances online services from Sharepoint 2007 to ASP.NET MVC
Worked on the design and implementation of the Quebec services government web site (https://mondossiercitoyen.gouv.qc.ca)
Internal project using MongoDB, React.js, Dropwizard (Java)
.NET, PHP, Java, Linux, Windows server
Working on the integration of StateFarm canada online services to Desjardins online services
REST and SOAP web services development in the new SOA architecture

work.summary: PG Solutions provides software solutions for local governments
highlights: Lead the architecture and implementation of PG Solutions SyGED solution, a paper and electronic document management application available on premises and hosted online.

Lead the architecture and implementation of SyMO, a mobile and web application solutions to optimize the work of nurses performing home care. The solution won 3M innovation grand prize in health care in 2008, and Quebec health agency first prize for excellence in 2009
.NET, Oracle database, XML, SOAP web services

work.summary: Seaquest developed an integrated marine information systems to be used by ports authorities
highlights: Designed and implemented a distributed object middleware to integrate specialized marine equipments under the same API and object model.
Helped develop drivers to interface different equipements to the middleware
Core technologie based on Java, with API available in C#, C++, Java.
Messages encoded using ASN.1, GML, ZeroC ICE

work.summary: Documex sold a railway inspection system comprised of a mobile client on PocketPC devices, and a web application backend.
highlights: Designed a synchronisation protocol between PocketPC and the backend application
Designed and implemented the rule based engine used to schedule inspection activities.
Worked on the web interface and report generation
Interfaced an XML form technology to the solution
Java, C, MySQL, Jasper Report, Struts, Spring

work.summary: Worked on Telus web development department, providing internal and external web application development services
highlights: Designed and implemented a search engine crawler used in Telus main web site and most of its clients

Participated in the development of a web content management system based on Java and XML.  The system was comprised of several independents modules: search engine, content publication, stats, mailing lists and others.
XML, Java, C++

work.summary: Software development on the USAnimation 2D animation software
highlights: Worked on the scene management module
Implementation of an undo/redo function

work.summary: CAE develops and sells full flight simulators for commercial and military clients.  Worked on the real-time image generator used in CAE's full flight sims.
highlights: Researched and implemented a novel color palette compression technique used in the texture processor.
Implemented test vector generation tools to validate ASIC chips
Ported 32 bits tools to the 64 bits DEC alpha processor.
Worked on the software simulation of the image generator to validate and test the system architecture
C, C++, SGI Irix, Sun Solaris, IBM AIX

awards.title: 3M clinical innovation grand prize
awards.summary: Awarded in recognition of the results achieved with the SyMO software
